string-array.name: description
string-array.item: An Activity is an application component that provides a screen with which users can interact in order to do something, such as dial the phone, take a photo, send an email, or view a map.
A Service is an application component that can perform long-running operations in the background and does not provide a user interface.
Content providers manage access to a structured set of data. They encapsulate the data, and provide mechanisms for defining data security.
An Intent is a messaging object you can use to request an action from another app component.

When an application component starts and the application does not have any other components running, the Android system starts a new Linux process for the application with a single thread of execution.
App Widgets are miniature application views that can be embedded in other applications (such as the Home screen) and receive periodic updates.
